oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mae Boren Axton interviewed by Bob Battle/BMI Awards 1980
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is Mae Boren Axton being interviewed by Bob Battle. The recording takes place on an unidentified date. The next part of the tape contains a speech from Ed Cramer at the 1980 BMI Awards.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mae Boren Axton; Frances W. Preston
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:13) -- Bob Battle speaks with Mae Boren Axton about her weekend. (0:44) -- Bob Battle asks about Grandmother Minnie Mae. (1:14) -- Bob Battle asks about the funeral of Grandmother Minnie Mae. (1:40) - End of phone call. (1:58) -- Vice president of BMI Frances Preston's introduction of BMI's president Ed Cramer. (3:28) -- Ed Cramer's speech about BMI's goals. (5:46) -- Ed Cramer describes meeting with the United States senate about songwriting legislation. Ed Cramer mentions that a particular United States senator did not believe that songwriters live regular lives. (9:05) -- Ed Cramer asks for help when fighting for royalties. (10:35) -- Ed Cramer's speech conclusion of the previous year. (10:55) -- Ed Cramer gives the floor back to Frances Preston. (11:53) -- Frances Preston gives an award to "All The Gold In California." (12:40) -- Bob Battle interviews Barbara Mandrell. Barbara speaks about working with the Nashville Symphony and a show made in California with her sisters Irlene and Louise. Barbara Mandrell discusses filming a movie and making a new live album. (15:28) -- Barbara Mandrell mentions she just signed a new contract with MCA. (16:18) -- Bob Battle asks Barbara Mandrell about her plans on making her first gospel album. (18:24) -- Charley Pride interview with Bob Battle. Charley Pride mentions that he wants to make new music, films, and TV. (19:21) -- Bob Battle asks Charley Pride about his future goals. (21:00) -- Introduction of Charlie Daniels "The Devil Went Down To Georgia."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Axton, Mae Boren; Preston, Frances Williams, 1928-2012;
